Thank you for your understanding. We hope you enjoy the rest of your summer.

CDE has submitted its ESSER application to the U.S. Department of Education, which has allocated close to $121 million to the state. At least 90% of funds will go to local education agencies (LEAs) based on 2019-20 Title I shares. The remaining 10% may be reserved at the state level for statewide support to LEAs in response to COVID or to provide additional grant opportunities for LEAs.

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

Contact: Norwood Public Schools Board of Education

Bette Nickell Resigns as Norwood Interim Superintendent

[Norwood, CO, March 25, 2020]

At the March 24th school board meeting the board accepted Bette Nickell's resignation for personal reasons related to concerns around the COVID-19 pandemic. In order to see us through this time of uncertainty and unknowns it was crucial we appoint an interim leader in her place for the remainder of the school year. This person, with the help of other staff, is Perri Gipner. Bette Nickell will continue as a consultant to our board and to Ms. Gipner through April and as needed beyond. At this time the board has made no decisions to halt the superintendent search however the board is also investigating all options in leadership structures for the 2020-2021 school year. We ask for your support and patience as we and our school staff navigate these strange times.

You Knew Me When is with Karisa Doughty Hoover at Norwood High School.
February 18 at 3:40 PM · Norwood, CO ·

For many kids, music is the only time in their school day to be creative, break out of their shell, open up to others, and take a break from the stressors in their lives. Music for music sake is valuable. There are too many schools that have lost funding for the arts. It was inspiring to see the arts in action at Norwood, Colorado school. Yesterday, we had the pleasure of performing for the middle and high school kids that take part in the Rock n Roll Academy program. We also discussed our experiences working as independent musicians, touring, the music business, and songwriting. It was awesome to see these kids fired up about playing and creating music!

#musicmatters Norwood High School

These entities responded quickly and efficiently and conducted a perimeter and interior search. We thank all the parents who were waiting to pick up their child and allowed the school and emergency personnel to do their jobs to ensure everyone’s safety. Students have been released and may be picked up or ride the bus as usual. The routes will be dropping off students about 30 minutes
late today.

Thank you for your cooperation,

Our students and staff responded appropriately and we are very proud of their immediate action to keep our children safe.

Upon investigation, there was no threat on campus and no indication of fire. We released students when the Norwood Fire Chief and law enforcement gave us the all clear. We thank all the parents who were waiting to pick up their child and allowed the school and emergency personnel to do their jobs to ensure everyone’s safety. Students have been released and may be picked up or ride the bus as usual. The routes will be dropping off students about 30 minutes
late today.

Thank you for your cooperation,

The Norwood Public School Administration
